member.name: T:NLog.LayoutRenderers.AppSettingLayoutRenderer
member.remarks: Use this layout renderer to insert the value of an application setting stored in the application's App.config or Web.config file.

member.name: M:NLog.LayoutRenderers.AppSettingLayoutRenderer.Append(System.Text.StringBuilder,NLog.LogEventInfo)
member.summary: Renders the specified application setting or default value and appends it to the specified .
member.param: The to append the rendered data to.

member.name: P:NLog.LayoutRenderers.AppSettingLayoutRenderer.Default
member.summary: The default value to render if the AppSetting value is null.

member.name: T:NLog.Targets.MessageQueueTarget
member.summary: Writes log message to the specified message queue handled by MSMQ.

example.p: To set up the target in the configuration file, use the following syntax:
You can use a single target to write to multiple queues (similar to writing to multiple files with the File target).
The above examples assume just one target and a single rule. More configuration options are described here.
To set up the log target programmatically use code like this:

member.name: M:NLog.Targets.MessageQueueTarget.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: The default value of the layout is: ${longdate}|${level:uppercase=true}|${logger}|${message}

member.name: M:NLog.Targets.MessageQueueTarget.Write(NLog.LogEventInfo)
member.summary: Writes the specified logging event to a queue specified in the Queue parameter.

member.name: M:NLog.Targets.MessageQueueTarget.PrepareMessage(NLog.LogEventInfo)
member.summary: Prepares a message to be sent to the message queue.
member.param: The log event to be used when calculating label and text to be written.
member.remarks: You may override this method in inheriting classes to provide services like encryption or message authentication.

member.name: P:NLog.Targets.MessageQueueTarget.Queue
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the queue to write to.
member.remarks: To write to a private queue on a local machine use .\private$\QueueName. For other available queue names, consult MSMQ documentation.

member.name: P:NLog.Targets.MessageQueueTarget.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets the label to associate with each message.
member.remarks: By default no label is associated.

member.name: P:NLog.Targets.MessageQueueTarget.CreateQueueIfNotExists
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create the queue if it doesn't exists.

member.name: P:NLog.Targets.MessageQueueTarget.Recoverable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use recoverable messages (with guaranteed delivery).

member.name: P:NLog.Targets.MessageQueueTarget.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding to be used when writing text to the queue.

member.name: P:NLog.Targets.MessageQueueTarget.UseXmlEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use the XML format when serializing message. This will also disable creating queues.

member.name: P:NLog.Targets.MessageQueueTarget.CheckIfQueueExists
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to check if a queue exists before writing to it.
